newsitem.title: USA: U.S. crudes bounce to firm levels, grades weaken.
newsitem.headline: U.S. crudes bounce to firm levels, grades weaken.

text.p: U.S. crudes gained to the close Thursday, ignoring headline-based jitters on possible impending Iraqi oil sales, traders said.
Fundamental bullishness in the heating oil sector, and the threat of extended delays to Mexican crude exports due to Hurricane Dolly buffeted the market.
Domestic grades were sold at weaker levels in extremely thin business ahead of Friday's nominations.
September West Texas Intermediate/Cushing ended at $22.40-$22.55, figuring in the Sep/Oct roll at 20-25 cents. The roll retreated from earlier asking levels at 35 cents.
Mexico's three main crude export ports: Pajaritos, Dos Bocas and Cayo Arcas, remained closed Thursday because of the threat from Dolly, which was reclassified as a hurricane.
Dolly gained strength late Thursday, forcing hurricane warnings to be issued along Mexico's northeast coast.
Developments at the United Nations seemed to indicate the implementation of the oil-for-food accord was within reach. Senior U.N. officials said the deal would be finalized in at least 10 days.
Domestic grades slipped to lower levels throughout the session, with October business looming over fading September.
Light Louisiana Sweet/St James was last heard traded at a 10 cents discount to WTI/Cushing, with Midland/WTI sold at 4 cents under the WTI price.
West Texas Sour/Midland traded late at minus $1.65, losing another 5 cents from early afternoon price levels.
The Sep/Oct roll was done at 20 and 22 cents, forcing the WTI/Cushing Posting Plus to under $2.00 by the end of the day.
Late Brent trading in the U.S. was confined to only partial outright deals, with a handful of paper spreads sold.
Traders said October Brent was done for a 250 lot parcel at $20.76, 3 cents higher than the IPE Brent close, and a second time at the same price for a separate 300 lot sale.
A further 50 lots were sold at $20.75 for October paper.
The Sep/Oct Brent spread was heard done at 55 cents, and the Oct/Nov at 46 cents in the aftermarket window.
